intro: Hieracium metanobile, commonly known as the alpine hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of Europe. It belongs to the daisy family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its hairy stems and yellow-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes. It has a rosette of basal leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Hieracium metanobile is adapted to cold climates and is often found in mountainous areas where other plants struggle to survive.
